item.title: The books I've read each year
item.description:
Short takeaways from books I’ve read over the years. I think distillation of information is an important mental muscle to keep strong. So I promise to always write these myself (sorry, chatgpt).

2024

The Untethered Soul Michael A. Singer
The Last Question Isaac Asimov
The Staff Engineer’s Path Tanya Reilly
The Psychology of Money Morgan Housel

2023

Elon Musk Walter Isaacson

I’m a huge fan of Elon Musk, so this book was a treat for me. It’s obvious to most of us that whatever Elon is doing is very special. He is running several large-scale companies (SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink, X, The Boring Company, maybe more?), and each is operating at lightspeed despite their size. How is he doing this?

item.title: Opening files with Vim from the Finder on macOS
item.description: I use Vim for most all the file editing I do on my Mac. I thought it’d be nice to be able to click on files in the Finder window and have them open up in my terminal for editing with Vim, so I wrote a bit of AppleScript to make it happen. This post shares how I set this up on my Mac so that you can do the same. The guide assumes that the terminal being used will be iTerm2.

item.title: How to use the theme on this website
item.description:
My first Hugo website theme, Devise, was recently accepted into the Hugo themes gallery. I’m excited to share that you can now use it for your own website.

You can find instructions for installing, configuring, and updating the theme here.

I’d greatly appreciate a Github project star ⭐ if you like the theme. If you have an idea for a new feature or found a bug, please feel free to use GitHub issues to let me know.

item.title: Writing a ray tracer in Go
item.description:
Table of Contents

  • Motivation
  • Tools for the Job
  • Rendering 1 - Projectile
  • Rendering 2 - Clock
  • Rendering 3 - 2D Spheres
  • Rendering 4 - 3D Spheres
  • Rendering 5 - World
  • Rendering 6 - World with Shadows

Motivation

I’d been curious about how graphics worked since playing video games as a child.

I decided to take the time to learn about graphics programming this year. After doing a bit of research on rendering techniques, I decided to learn about a particular technique called ray tracing. Ray tracing can be used to render photorealistic scenes.
